PATIENT_ID: TEST_PEN_ABD_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-01 14:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-01 14:10:00
Category I activation for 34-year-old male with penetrating abdominal injury.
Stab wound to left lower quadrant with evisceration of omentum.
Entry wound located in the left lower abdominal quadrant.
BP 92/58, HR 122, RR 22, GCS 15.
Hemodynamic instability with peritoneal signs on examination.
Exam reveals diffuse abdominal tenderness with guarding and rigidity.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-01 14:15:00
FAST exam performed. Positive FAST examination with free fluid in Morrison pouch.
Hemodynamic status: unstable. Vitals trending down.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-01 14:25:00
CT abdomen/pelvis not obtained due to hemodynamic instability.
Wound exploration performed at bedside: fascial penetration confirmed.
Anterior abdominal fascia violated.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-01 14:30:00
Operative decision made for emergent laparotomy.
Surgical intervention indicated given evisceration, positive FAST, and hemodynamic instability.
Patient taken to OR for exploratory laparotomy.
